name: Umite Chef Mixing Bowls with Airtight Lids, 6 Piece Stainless Steel Metal Bowls, Measurement Marks & Colorful Non-Slip Bottoms Size 7, 3.5, 2.5, 2.0,1.5, 1QT, Great for Mixing & Serving
about_this_item: PREMIUM MATERIAL: Each bowl is made of high-quality heavy gauge stainless steel, which is resistant and rustproof. Umite Chef mixing bowls feature a mirror finish interior and fingerprint-proofexterior. High-quality food grade stainless steel, you and your family can ues it with peace of mind

LARGER BOWL SIZES: Our stainless bowls deeeper than standard bowl sets, allow for larger servings . This set contains sizes1.5, 2.0, 2.5, 3.5, 7 quarts, that gives you much more flexibility, and less mess, satisfy your demands for mixing large batters, tossing salads, washing vegetable, marinating and storing, etc
EASY TO CLEAN:The silver bowls feature a shiny interior and fingerprint-proof satin exterior, Which are simple to clean by hand
NON SLIP SILICONE BOTTOMS: Flat silicone bases prevent the metal bowls slippage when mixing, you need not to worry about the bowls will wobble when mixing, beating and whipping.
TIGHT-COLORFUL LIDS: Flexible BPA free plastic lids closely fit the bowls, keep your food fresh, tight fitting lids are great for food storage, great choice for storing food for longer.

title: Easy to store!
content: Compact, neutral, and holds a lot! The durability is fantastic and I love how they all stack inside of one another, calls for easy storage!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I love the bowls. They were lighter in weight than I thought. The lids may be slightly bent, but they fit perfectly into the bowls. The colors are cute and very practical. I recommend them and would buy them again.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2024

title: Love the bowls
content: I love that they nest nicely and are color coded with bottoms that match their tops. Great for use with cooking and baking.  Also love to store leftovers in them.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I grew up in a household that only ever used glass mixing bowls, so this is my first experience with metal ones so I don’t know if they’re supposed to be this soft and scratch this easy or not but I was quite shocked. The very first time i used them I used my hand mixer to whip up some quick buttercream and I was shocked at how awfully scratched it was afterwards. Like I said, I don’t know if that’s normal but I feel like even if it is, these bowls seem softer to me. Just wanted to mention this for future buyers to be aware of.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2024

title: Love the bowls and tops
content: The lids fit well but do not make them leak-proof. The colour of the lids is nice too and they look exactly like the image.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I think these bowls are great value for money though, particularly if you’re like me and desperately needed new mixing bowls, but aren’t too picky.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024

title: Love it but they scratch easy
content: The kids bent a little after washing them on the top rack, but they still close. The bowls are great, and I would definitely recommend them. Just... hand wash the lids if you care about them.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Bought for my mother to replace very large tupperware bowl she had purchased from our milkman (yes milk delivery man) 50 years ago that finally cracked!  She loves them.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024

title: Lids not fully dishwasher safe
content: I love the colors of the lids and the bottoms of these bowls.  The grip of the bottom of the bowls on the counter makes for an easier time mixing ingredients.  I would recommend hand washing the lids.  Left one of these at a relative’s home and they washed it in the dishwasher, bowl was fine but the lid won’t seal well any longer.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: If the lids would stay on... they would be a five star for me.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024

title: Great bowls, lids have issues
content: I love these stainless steel stacking bowls.  I'm not a fan of the lids.  The lids do work wonderfully, as long as you don't refrigerate them.  I opened my fridge and found the lid curled off the bowl.  I can use the lids and have them work properly as long as they remain room temperature.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I was looking for some metal mixing bowls to use when I use my mixer. These bowls have been wonderful! Very stable, doesn’t slip. I even tried the highest speed of my mixer and didn’t put a hand on the bowl- stayed stable! Very large bowls and great quality for the price. The only downside is the lids. The lids do not stay secure. I don’t store things in mixing bowls often, so this isn’t a deal breaker for myself, but may be for some looking.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024

title: Great, nonslip bowls! Lid doesn’t stay on though.
content: These bowls are very nice. The lids however are a different story. As soon as you put the sealed bowl and lid in the fridge and they get cold, they will no longer seal. It wouldn’t be a huge deal but it’s hard for my husband to bring a salad to work in his lunch box (construction) when the lids won’t stay on and that was the main reason for this purchase.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: So many bowls, each with lids and the nonstick bottoms make these bowls, outstanding!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024

title: Lids won’t suction when cold.
content: Great set of bowls with several different sizes for all your cooking and storage needs. Sturdy and well designed. The silicone bottoms are nice on noise reduction on your countertop. Easy to clean and store since they nest inside eachother.  The only down side is that the lids are not "airtight". The lids fit nicely, but are not snug enough. The plastic is rigid and doesn't always fit the bowl tightly. Otherwise I would have given them a 5 star rating.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I bought these after my plastic bowls were just too scratched to keep. I love these. They are lightweight, yet sturdy. They stay put on the counter. I use them a lot and they have held up well.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2024

title: Great value!
content: I needed a good set of stainless bowls and I liked they came with lids.  You just put the lid and press down and it pressurizes for a good seal on most of the set.  Unfortunately a couple of the bowls lids don’t work as well but overall I’m good with them.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I'm 70 years young and these are the Best bowls I have ever had!!  I cleaned out my kitchen, new appliances, gave the church things I don't use, the inside of my cabinets rearranged, and shined the cabinets.  While I was doing this I was watching a tv show and they presented bowls.  I stopped what I was doing and checked it out then as always I checked out Amazon and found these.  The rating were like night and day!  These are Beautiful and they do stay put when mixing!!  I love Amazon!!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2024

title: Mixing bowl set
content: I washed these and started using them. They are pretty and sturdy and easy to use. However, the first lid I used would NOT STAY ON. I purchased these because the hard plastic bowls I currently use have lids that do not stay on. What good is a lid if it doesn't seal?
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I know it’s on the high-end in terms of price for bowls, however, the quality, I think it’s worth it the stackability, the textured bottom of each bowl, the airtight lids they wash well I just hand wash mine. I think if you want to elevate your kitchen. This is one option for you. I do really really like them though. You can make a salad. You can put the lid on it. Keep it in the fridge you can they’re nice enough you can use them to display your fruit. If you need to prep to make a cake or some thing, I think that they’re a good product very well-made and they’re not just your traditional  Bowl not that there’s anything wrong with that but I’m saying if you wanna elevate the look of your kitchen without doing like a major revamp, you can always change your bowls and your hot pads and towels and give your kitchen space and entirely different look. There a nice white bowl , it’s not your cheap flimsy tin. Feeling kind of bowl. These bowls are very good quality. I highly recommend.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
content: Sturdy enough to actually USE; but light enough for older hands & wrists to manipulate. I love the coated bottom for counter stabilization. I don't know if that will affect using them over hot water for tempering chocolate or eggs & butter; but if so, I have one that's non-coated. However, it is something to consider. The lids fit well; but not water-tight in all cases. The size range gives me prep bowls & dough rising bowls to a big bowl for party salads. I absolutely recommend these!

title: Would Buy Again
content: The biggest surprise: I know it is not wise to put something hot in metal bowls if you want to avoid getting burned. I also know that the silicone base is probably not oven proof.  But I accidentally left one drying inside the oven and didn't discover it until the oven had preheated to 425º !!! It was smoking a bit but did not melt or deform in any way. I can't even tell which bowl it was anymore.

title: Lid needs replaced
content: HATE the lids, LOVE the bowls. After washing the bowls & lids in the dishwasher (and nowhere does it say you should not) after unpacking them, no matter what 'video or write-up' I follow to properly use / place these lids, they will not stay seated and make that airtight seal. I have 'adjusted' as shown in the product video - bent, place in a deep at an angle, pressed down hard - it rises up and no airtight seal is provided. Lids should not be rocket-science. Perhaps I just got a bad batch of lids & bowls OR the dishwasher (only air-dry setting) wrecked them. Not a single one will seal.  I am not 'putting them on wrong' and  I have 'aligned them properly' .... nope. I will do something else with the lids as I passed my return window.  AND, the lids do not stack inside like other sets, they must linger about on top taking up space.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: All sizes were here. They were nicely stacked and organized in box. Very sturdy and thick. Can't wait to use them.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2024
